verses.verse: And Job<WH347> again<WH3254> took up his parable<WH4912>, and said<WH559>,
Oh that<WH5414> I were as in the months<WH3391> of old<WH6924>, As in the days<WH3117> when God<WH433> watched over me<WH8104>;
When his lamp<WH5216> shined<WH1984> upon my head<WH7218>, And by his light<WH216> I walked<WH3212> through darkness<WH2822>;
As I was in the ripeness<WH2779> of my days<WH3117>, When the friendship<WH5475> of God<WH433> was upon my tent<WH168>;
When the Almighty<WH7706> was yet with me<WH5288>, And my children were about me<WH5439>;
When my steps<WH1978> were washed<WH7364> with butter<WH2529>, And the rock<WH6697> poured me out<WH6694> streams<WH6388> of oil<WH8081>!
When I went forth<WH3318> to the gate<WH8179> unto the city<WH7176>, When I prepared<WH3559> my seat<WH4186> in the street<WH7339>,
The young men<WH5288> saw<WH7200> me and hid<WH2244> themselves<WH3453>, And the aged rose up<WH6965> and stood<WH5975>;
The princes<WH8269> refrained<WH6113> from talking<WH4405>, And laid<WH7760> their hand<WH3709> on their mouth<WH6310>;
The voice<WH2244> of the nobles<WH5057> was hushed<WH6963>, And their tongue<WH3956> cleaved<WH1692> to the roof of their mouth<WH2441>.
For when the ear<WH241> heard<WH8085> me<WH833>, then it blessed me<WH5869>; And when the eye saw<WH7200> me<WH5749>, it gave witness unto me:
Because I delivered<WH4422> the poor<WH6041> that cried<WH7768>, The fatherless<WH3490> also<WH5826>, that had none to help him.
The blessing<WH1293> of him that was ready to perish<WH6> came<WH935> upon me<WH490>; And I caused the widow's heart<WH3820> to sing for joy<WH7442>.
I put<WH3847> on righteousness<WH6664>, and it clothed<WH3847> me<WH4941>: My justice was as a robe<WH4598> and a diadem<WH6797>.
I was eyes<WH5869> to the blind<WH5787>, And feet<WH7272> was I to the lame<WH6455>.
I was a father<WH1> to the needy<WH34>: And the cause<WH7379> of him that I knew<WH3045> not I searched out<WH2713>.
And I brake<WH7665> the jaws<WH4973> of the unrighteous<WH5767>, And plucked<WH7993> the prey<WH2964> out of his teeth<WH8127>.
Then I said<WH559>, I shall die<WH1478> in my nest<WH7064>, And I shall multiply<WH7235> my days<WH3117> as the sand<WH2344>:
My root<WH8328> is spread out<WH6605> to the waters<WH4325>, And the dew<WH2919> lieth all night<WH3885> upon my branch<WH7105>;
My glory<WH3519> is fresh<WH2319> in me<WH5978>, And my bow<WH7198> is renewed<WH2498> in my hand<WH3027>.
Unto me men gave ear<WH8085>, and waited<WH3176>, And kept silence<WH1826> for<WH3926> my counsel<WH6098>.
After <WH310> my words<WH1697> they spake not again<WH8138>; And my speech<WH4405> distilled upon them<WH5197>.
And they waited<WH3176> for me as for the rain<WH4306>; And they opened<WH6473> their mouth<WH6310> wide as for the latter rain<WH4456>.
I smiled<WH7832> on them<WH539>, when they had no confidence; And the light<WH216> of my countenance<WH6440> they cast not down<WH5307>.
I chose<WH977> out their way<WH1870>, and sat<WH3427> as chief<WH7218>, And dwelt<WH7931> as a king<WH4428> in the army<WH1416>, As one that comforteth<WH5162> the mourners<WH57>.
